text: Kristine Beate Walhovd (born 1976) is a Norwegian psychologist, neuroscientist and Professor of Neuropsychology at the University of Oslo.Kristine Beate Walhovd, University of Oslo Together with her husband, fellow neuroscientist Anders Fjell, she established the Centre of Lifespan Changes in Brain and Cognition at the University of Oslo, which was given the status of "world leading research environment" by the Government of Norway in 2015.Utpekt til verdensledende hjerneforskereUiOs fem verdensledende forskningsmiljøer She and her husband shared the Fridtjof Nansen Prize in 2007.Hjerne og forstandsaktivitet i et livsløpsperspektiv She was elected as a member of the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters in 2011.Hjerne og forstandsaktivitet i et livsløpsperspektiv, DNVA In 2017 she received a European Research Council consolidator grant.Kristine Walhovd får Consolidator Grant According to Google Scholar, she has been cited over 14,000 times in scientific literature and has an h-index of 67.Kristine Beate Walhovd, Google Scholar ==References== Category:Norwegian psychologists Category:Norwegian neuroscientists Category:Neuropsychologists Category:University of Oslo faculty Category:Members of the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters Category:Norwegian women neuroscientists Category:Women psychologists Category:21st-century Norwegian scientists Category:21st-century women scientists Category:21st-century psychologists Category:1976 births Category:Living people
title: Kristine Beate Walhovd
